result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.
result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Martin J Healey

records.addlTxt:
Defendant Martin J Healey in court, in custody by video.  Prosecuting attorney Andrew Herrmann in court for the State of Wisconsin. Attorney Josh Ryan appeared for bond purposes only. Total cash bond set, all same priors plus new no violent contact conditions. Minutes filed.
Further proceedings scheduled for November 11, 2022 at 01:15 pm.

BOND TO COVER 22GF1135, 22CF546 & 22CM557

Defendant shall not possess or consume alcohol. Defendant shall not possess or use illegal drugs or drug paraphernalia. Defendant will not possess any firearms, ammunition or other weapons. Defendant will not in any way contact or attempt to contact any victim(s) listed and will avoid their residence/place of employment or any place they are located and will avoid causing any other person, other than defendant's attorney, from doing so on defendant's behalf.  The term "no contact" is hereby defined as through the mail, by telephone, by way of electronic device, in person, or through a third party.  VICTIM(S)/RESIDENCE(S): NO CONTACT WITH A.N.H. dob 5-28-1985 or RESIDENCE IN EAST TROY, WI. NO CONTACT WITH ST. PETER'S CONGREGATIONAL CHURCH IN EAST TROY, OR PARISH OFFICE OF ST. PETERS, OR ST. PETER'S CLOTHING STORE, OR GERARD'S EMBRACE. NO CONTACT WITH ANY PRIVATE OR PUBLIC SCHOOLS IN EAST TROY, WI. NO VIOLENT CONTACT WITH SGT R.G. OR DEPUTY J.S. "No violent contact" includes threats through the mail, by telephone, by way of electronic device, in person or through a third party.  Defendant shall personally ensure that payments are made under any Order for Income Withholding if the Court appoints an attorney for the defendant.
22-4864, 22-5128 & 22-5129

Defendant Martin J Healey in court, in custody by video.  Prosecuting attorney J J. Crawford in court for the State of Wisconsin. Court wants defendant to fill out MFAC paperwork. Minutes filed.
Hearing scheduled for October 18, 2022 at 08:30 am.
Notice of Motion and Motion for Establishment of Discovery Deadlines.

records.addlTxt: Signed bond filed with the court.

Defendant Martin J Healey in court, in custody by video. Attorney Mackenzie Renner appeared. Attorney Vivien TenHaken for the State. Bond to cover both cases. Defendant would like to represent himself. Court grants defendant to represent himself on bond. Minutes filed.
Hearing scheduled for October 14, 2022 at 01:15 pm.

*SEE BOND SET 11/4/2022*
*AMENDED: BOND TO COVER BOTH CHARGES 22GF1038 & 22GF1043

Defendant shall not possess or consume alcohol. Defendant shall not possess or use illegal drugs or drug paraphernalia. Defendant will not possess any firearms, ammunition or other weapons. Defendant will not in any way contact or attempt to contact any victim(s) listed and will avoid their residence/place of employment or any place they are located and will avoid causing any other person, other than defendant's attorney, from doing so on defendant's behalf.  The term "no contact" is hereby defined as through the mail, by telephone, by way of electronic device, in person, or through a third party.  VICTIM(S)/RESIDENCE(S): NO CONTACT WITH A.N.H. dob 5-28-1985 or RESIDENCE IN EAST TROY, WI. NO CONTACT WITH ST. PETER'S CONGREGATIONAL CHURCH IN EAST TROY, OR PARISH OFFICE OF ST. PETERS, OR ST. PETER'S CLOTHING STORE, OR GERARD'S EMBRACE. NO CONTACT WITH ANY PRIVATE OR PUBLIC SCHOOLS IN EAST TROY, WI. Defendant shall personally ensure that payments are made under any Order for Income Withholding if the Court appoints an attorney for the defendant.
